meanings.definition: To press or squeeze something so that it becomes flat or compacted.
meanings.sent1: I squished the playdough into a small ball.
meanings.sent2: The cat squished itself into the tiny box.
meanings.sent3: The sandwich looked funny after being squished in my bag.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt squished with sadness.
meanings.sent5: The grapes were squished into juice by the heavy weight.

meanings.definition: To be squeezed or pressed tightly between two surfaces.
meanings.sent1: The toy car got squished between the books on the shelf.
meanings.sent2: The bug squished when the door closed on it.
meanings.sent3: I felt squished in the crowded elevator.
meanings.sent4: The idea was squished out of his mind by the new information.
meanings.sent5: The cookie was squished flat by the heavy book on top of it.

meanings.definition: To crush or flatten something by applying pressure.
meanings.sent1: She accidentally squished the cupcake in her hand.
meanings.sent2: The snowman squished when I stepped on it.
meanings.sent3: The pillow was squished into a weird shape by the cat.
meanings.sent4: His dreams were squished by the harsh reality.
meanings.sent5: The car squished the empty can on the road.
